description:
Been here so many times it's hard to count. It is the first place I've ever eaten sushi, of which I was terrified. I'm vegetarian so I thought it was impossible. Turns out it's not. 

I get:

Shiitake make (mushroom roll)
Inari (rice covered in an envelope of thin tofu that's sweet so it's a little like a dessert - so good)
Kanpyo (pickled gourd - a bit chewy in a good way, that isn't vinegary at all, gently sweet, also fantastic)

Haven't been in a long time but still so memorable. 

Best thing is there's an underground parking garage accessible from 21st Street that always has spaces.
author: Laney L.

description:
I left delivery instructions with GrubHub that were not passed to the restaurant. Delivery man goes to wrong door, calls me. I let him know that I had left instructions - he goes away w/o eye contact, or acknowledging me. Comes back, rings my bell, shows me his phone and rudely insists that I didn't "help everyone" by leaving instructions.

I tell him that the instructions weren't given to him, but that I left them carefully, and that a disabled woman lives upstairs at the bell he rang. He rudely commented, **laughed at me** and went to his car.

Also, 4 sticks overcooked asparagus for $5?
author: Cara H.

description:
Stumbled across this sushi spot in the mission. The menu looked decent so my friends and I decided to try it out. The waitress was not really friendly. She seemed annoyed that we were there and that  we weren't ready when she came to take our order. Honestly was so surprised by her attitude. 

Some of the sushi was good, although didn't taste really fresh. Most of the sushi already had wasabi in it. Not really common. I had to scrape the wasabi off.

I would come back, hopefully a better experience next time.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Sushi was not good. Kind of bitter. Definitely not fresh.

First off no greeting when we walked thru the door. We seated ourselves. The lady brought us our menus. The male server came back about a minute later and asked if he could take our order, told him we weren't ready yet. 

A minute later as I'm staring at their menu the lady that brought the menus comes back and says "You guys look ready." In my head I'm thinking 'I'm still looking at the menu, how does that look ready?' I looked up at her and asked for another minute.

She comes back literally a minute later. This time I'm holding the menu up to my face. I look up from the menu at her and she goes "Ready?" I shake my head, no. Can yall be patient please my goodness!

Got the philly roll, creamy crab roll, and dragon roll. The philly was okay, nothing special. The salmon was not the freshest. The creamy crab roll was my least favorite which was disappointing cause that's the one I chose. Don't let the name fool you, there was nothing creamy about it, it was dry af. The dragon roll was the one I thought was bitter.

We also got the tempura combo appetizer. The shrimp was skinny and mushy like it wasn't fresh and the vegetable tempura was just shredded carrots, potatoes, and green beans. It was like a veggie hash brown. 

After we got our food the servers never attended to us again which was crazy cause they were on our backs about ordering in the first place. It was like they just wanted us to order our food and get it over with. The servers weren't rude but I just wasn't happy with their service.

On a positive note, the place was peaceful, quiet and not busy for Valentine's Day which I liked but I still wouldn't recommend going here on Valentine's Day.. Very decorated inside with paper lanterns and Japanese art on the walls. The lights were very dim so I guess you can say it's romantic, somewhat.
author: Madelynn A.

description:
I do not recommend the Chicken Teriyaki plate.  Chicken was boiled instead of grilled and the sauce was like salty ketcup not teriyaki. I ordered a yellowtail roll that had the smallest pieces of fish and the rice fell apart all forabout $20. 
I had no choice but to eat since there was my lunch break and I waited so long for the chicken.
author: Allyn M.

description: This place looks cute and quaint, but there are better sushi places in the city, let alone the Mission. We got there around the time they opened, and it was hot and muggy inside. I immediately chugged down the water that was offered to me because I felt like I was boiling. They eventually opened the front door to let air in. We ordered our dishes, and they came out quickly, granted we were the first only people in there for the first 30 minutes. The sushi didn't taste that fresh, and didn't stick to the rice that well. They also screwed up our order; my girlfriend didn't even received her order, after asking the waitress twice about it (her English was not that well). It's cheap and small, but I'll take my business elsewhere.
author: Joel G.

description: I used to go to this restaurant often but I was very disappointed this time. The server was poor, didn't bring my tea without a second request, and seemed to have her mind elsewhere. When the food arrived, the miso soup had no tofu in it--the first time that has ever happened, even at this restaurant. The veggie special was weak. The inari sushi was barely filled with rice. The visual presentation was poor. Couldn't wait to leave.
author: Vico G.

description: Quick service, affordable sushi, and nice little spot in Valencia. Perfect for a date, especially after handing out at Dolores Park.
author: Joseph A.

description:
Great find! But apparently I've been missing out for the last 30 years cuz that's how long that this hidden gem has been here.  

The sushi is solid and the sale list is great. I love the small feel. Will definitely come back.....
author: Dean D.

description: The best vegan/vegetarian pizza ever! I really enjoyed the marinated mushroom, the vegetable tempura, and presentation of the cut rolls. The next time I am in San Francisco, I'm going to eat here.
author: Carlos V.

description:
One of the most affordable non-taco eateries in the Mission District. I love We Be Sushi for their lunch specials--from the tempura to the mackerel. I've tried almost all of them! Their selection of specialty rolls is small, but has they have staples like the Rainbow roll. They do have a large selection of maki  and a decent nigiri list. 

Love the service, too. The waitress who works there at lunch is the sweetest even when she's working all by herself in a room full of customers. 

If you are a sushi lover with a tight budget, this is the place to go!
author: Joanna S.

description:
I am definitely a fan of We Be Sushi for the price point and convenience of a cheap, decent sushi place on Valencia. A and I stopped in for a quick weeknight dinner following my Ulcer diagnosis from Golden Gate Urgent Care next door after figuring that plain raw fish was probably safe for me to eat.

I opted for the Sushi Dinner Set ($16.95) which included numerous pieces of Nigiri, a Shitake Mushroom roll and a California roll with a Miso Soup. A went with the early bird special (served until 7pm) for ~$12 which came with his choice of 5 pieces of Nigiri, one of their speciality rolls (possibly the Valencia roll), seaweed salad, rice and Miso Soup.

Our soups came first and to be honest, it wasn't too great. Definitely worse than average but still edible. Regardless, I was starving and just wanted some bland comfort food so this was fine. A's salad and rice also came with the soup which I just stared longingly at. Our fish arrived ~10 minutes later and honestly, the presentation was much better than I expected. Everything was well-plated and the cuts of fish were generous. We both dug in and were satisfied. Was the quality amazing? No. Was the fish insanely fresh? No. But it was definitely more than passable, especially considering the quantity for the price. This is one of the few times I feel like I have gotten a good value for sushi in SF and for that alone, this place deserves praise.

I definitely feel like we will be back, especially as I can eat more of the menu shortly. This was the perfect meal for both of us on a busy weeknight. The menu includes plenty of non-sushi items as well so I can imagine this place gets busy. The space is a bit small and I didn't see anything larger than a 4-top so just something to keep in mind if you're planning on coming with a group.
author: Carrie W.

description: I spent $50 here... on just three sushi rolls. Mad expensive. They weren't all specialty rolls either. I believe two were and one was regular. The rolls are huge though, I'll give them that much. And the waitress was good about refilling my water and tea. However, too pricy and quality was just OK. Didn't satisfy my sushi craving the right way. Won't return.
author: Marie D.

description: I'm from so cal and this is probably my favorite sushi I've ever had! Defiantly tastes homemade and they had vegetarian options too! The service was great the waitresses were very sweet older women
author: Natalie T.

description: Sushi rolls we very much on the small side. Long-ish wait, perhaps because they do a lot of takeout. Friendly service. Not the lowest cost either. I don't know about the dinners. The California roll did seem to be made of real crab.
author: Carol S.

description: Friendly and cozy and in a great neighborhood. The sushi is alright but not amazing. The price is reasonable but not amazing. The udon and tempura are totally decent, but not deeply satisfying. This place is right in the middle of everything. A solid .3 stars.
author: David A R.

description:
Decent sushi, excellent service, great prices
The complimentary green tea with brown rice is delicious and perfect for those windy days
Basic menu, good lunch options (comes with a bit of seaweed salad, miso soup and rice topped with fish flakes)
Ordered a lunch special that included 5 pieces of nigiri (customer choice) + valencia roll (very basic but good)
Perfectly cooked edamame
Our server was extremely attentive and sweet. She really made this a great experience. 
$31 for 3 people for sushi is a steal!!
Obviously can't compare to higher end sushi joints but if you're looking for a no frills affordable fresh sushi option, give this place a try!
author: Yin H.

description:
This place is still awesome - for the budget-conscious who don't have to check for peas under their mattresses.

I always get: Miso, Tekka Maki, Hamachi Negi, and Rock n' Roll. Always great. 

Living in Japan, I ate sushi from convenience stores several times. A couple times I got sick, and it was definitely the fish because that's all I threw up even though I also ate plenty of other stuff. THAT HAS NEVER HAPPENED FROM WE BE SUSHI. (I have definitely gotten sick from a chinese place around the corner, though")

San Francisco is part of that 'bubble' being talked about these days. Yes, even you who works for peanuts at a $6 cup coffee joint are in a bubble.

We Be, the southern one between 21st and 22nd, is still great. A couple of new staff since I wrote my last review and they're still courteous. I'm sure if you treat them like a member of Louis XVI's court you won't be on their good side.

Think about it for a second, if you're mature enough to consider people other than yourself: this place has to earn income for quite expensive rent, utilities, SF minimum-wage salaries (and higher), AND the food. Fish you can eat raw is NOT cheap. Notice how FEW seats they've got. 

The owners have found a price sweet-spot that can sell enough volume to stay open yet STILL attract locals. Locals who are only local because of rent control. Families who've lived here longer than you (most of you complainers) have been alive. Yes, every time I go in there are local people eating, not just 'poor' millenials from upper middle-class families.

We Be is not gourmet. If you've only eaten sushi in the US you probably have no idea what great sushi is, anyway. Stop being pretentious, especially when you come here and pay less than $5 a roll! Come off it!

* About Yelp's warning pop-up: GTH! This place is FINE and lots of people eat hear all the time.
author: Steve M.

description: One of my favorite sushi spots in San Francisco. Great sushi for a great price - and the staff is so friendly, accommodating, and amazing. Will definitely be back.
author: Ellison M.

description: I have been coming here for  five years and lately was a little disappointed as the happy hour option was changed. Please bring back that amazing deal.  I used to drive across town for it. The recipe for the Valencia roll has changed as well. Please keep things the way they were. If you add wine options you will make the money needed without compromising the quality of the happy hour offerings. I always bring guests! I will continue to return, just keep what is working, working. You are my favorite sushi staple in SF and I want to keep bringing my friends and family. When the original chef returned from Japan, the fish was above and beyond anything We Be Sushi near 22nd and Valencia had released. It was like I was dining in an exclusive authentic high end sushi restaurant  in Japan. It was a privilege. Please keep your game strong. San Franciscans love to come in!!
author: Simone N.

description: To start, I HATE writing reviews,... on anything. BUT, this one had to happen. If you had asked me 6 months ago, I would have given this place 5 stars. We were regulars and always enjoyed the secret hole in the wall vibe and quiet peaceful atmosphere. The sushi wasn't amazing with a capital A, but was reliably good and we brought our friends here often. Tonight however, was the most ridiculous server experience I've ever had in my life. The waitress appeared to be drunk, or just realllly not into it. It was about an hours worth of listening to her sing, make vulgar remarks, slam dishes around, and even make racist remarks about Japanese people. She delivered our food with a stern faced "here", which was a first for me.. and actually had the nerve to say "everything ok, you're making a weird face." I will come back here as soon as she doesn't work there. What happened to the nice staff? They were cool. bring them back :)
author: Sorcha S.

description:
Pro
The Japanese waitress was friendly
The seaweed salad is as you'd expect out of the box
The avocado in all their rolls was tasty

Con
Food was nasty
Worst bang for the buck
Food was NASTY

Details:
This is probably the worst non-authentic sushi joint I've ever been to.  Perhaps I have not tried out enough Miso soups, but I've never had one with carrots and white onions.  I do not recall those are even ingredients used in traditional miso soup receipts.  Maybe I missed something.

The fried Calamari was rubbery.  Worst of all, the batter was thick and soggy.  Expectations are crunchy and flaky.

We also ordered three separate rolls (Rainbow, Spider, and one with the eel).  They were all terrible and far below par.  Generally, the fish was not fresh.  Even the fake crab meat was questionable.  The eel was overcooked, in fact, this is the first place I had burnt eel in sushi.  The softshell crab in the spider roll tasted weird, soggy, oily and looked super dark brown.  The batter was probably cooked in old used oil.  The rice in the rolls was also soggy, it tasted like they skipped a few tablespoon of rice vinegar.

To recap about the sushi at this place.
1) Rice sucked
2) Fish sucked
3) Seaweed was okay
4) Avocado was great  
5) $$$
author: Sai Kiu H.

description:
- Fish was fresh
- Food came quickly
- Roll was simple and delicious, good value
- Sashimi was competitive value
- Miso soup included

Cons:
- Grouchy and overwhelmed waitress
- 15% more than I would want to pay for basic sushi experience
author: Lovina H.

description:
Dim lights - so you can not see all this dirt. 
Food is ok. Price little too hight. 

Do they even now about customer service? Feels that server hates everybody.
Or was it just me :)

Do go there during day light, you will see dust and old flowers. It's time to throw those awaaaay

There are better places in this city to get sushi.
author: Marianna P.

description:
We Be Sushi gets a lot of things right:
- The food is fresh
- The service is fast
- The atmosphere is chill
- They give you loads e food

It's a little expensive, but you get what you pay for here. Don't be afraid to try the "We Be Chicken" -- it's surprisingly solid!
author: Casey S.

description: You get what you pay. Very mediocre sushi. Service was efficient and good. But food blah! Tried a few maki and special maki. Dontknow about nigiri.Can do so much better given there are multiple awesome places around. But if you are on a budget good idea. Place is small and has nice feeling to it. But not going back
author: Shital R.

description:
I've been coming here for years. 
very dependable, always fresh. 
basic menu, basic rolls, good fish, good rice, good miso. 
they seem to have changed the recipe for the seaweed salad, but it was still tasty. 
small place, so you may have to wait, but they turn over tables fast. 
service here is not white tablecloth, OK ? Don't expect it. 

What you can expect is a pretty quick turnaround once you order. They pump out so much food for their small kitchen, but again, always fresh & tasty. 

this is where I go when I want good fresh, basic sushi in the Mission.
author: Adrian M.

description:
I really want to like this place because they are soooo sweet and reasonably priced. But, the food is just not that good. The tempura is kinda... Lackluster? Small veggies and shrimp in a way that made me want to sing "womp womp" when it arrived at our table. 

Plus, the rolls are not that fat. I want, like, BINDERS FULL OF SALMON. Not a token piece of salmon. BINDERS, PEOPLE.

The fish is fresh enough. It's not... bad. It's just not that good.
author: Jessa D.

description:
...  Someone claimed that this place was super affordable and super amazing.  ...

It was Meh... at best.
The server lady (meant well)... mostly cranky and overwhelmed.  I don't think she was in a job/role that suited her interests...  

Food was... Meh... at best.  Edible and tasted okay.
author: Arry Y.

description:
This place is average. Hence the 3 stars. The price is right, the food is descent. The only thing that's lacking is the service. One of my friends loves this place and every time we come here I can expect 2 hours to be taken out of my day just because the service is that slow. The fish isn't very fresh, but it's not rotting either. It's just meh, like when you go to Wendy's or Burger King. I guess I know what to expect when I come here, but I've had better and I've also had worse.

What we had: spider roll, California roll, tuna roll, eel roll, fresh salmon, inari, nausu, chirashi.
author: Jack R.

description:
This is a tiny little place with good sushi for the money. It's really small and we did have to wait a bit to get a table, but our server gave us some edamame on the house since we had to wait so long. Our servers were nice, although a tad slow.

I can only speak for the maki, but it was all good. The Mexican roll was great! We also got a prawn tempura and an eel and spicy tuna roll and those were good as well. Just an FYI, there are a lot more maki options than those listed on their website. 

Basically, this is a pretty solid value of sushi for your money!
author: Amy Y.

description:
I love sushis and only tasted those in SF ... 
But living un Belgium, and being used to eating them, they're really really good !
author: Quentin C.

description:
Worst dining experience I've had in a LONG time, so bad that by the time I was halfway done eating I'd already begun making a list of all the awful things I wanted to mention on Yelp once I got home.  I will say, I went in at 9:15, which is not too far off from closing time, so I guess everyone's tired... But that is not a good enough excuse for how awful this experience was.

When I walked in, there were 7 others dining, a group of four, a table of two and one girl by herself.  The girl by herself had just gotten her dish when I was walking in, and she was hesitant I could tell, but called the waitress back over and gently stated it wasn't at all what she had ordered.  They gave her some sort of variety platter but she had just ordered a tuna sashimi.  She even told them they didn't have to replace it, and said "no no its fine, I mean I already touched this.  It's fine, just not what I ordered."  She looked pretty annoyed though.

They took about 2 minutes to even LOOK at me, and the restaurant is teeny tiny, so literally everyone else was starting to stare at me by the time they sat me down.  The waitress that seated me didn't give me a menu, I assumed she'd be right back with one, but she wasn't.  I sat and waited for about 5 minutes before the other waitress came over, and the first thing out of her mouth was, "Wow, did she really seat you and not give you a menu?  Ridiculous."  And she went away again with a huff to go get me a menu.  Now of course I appreciate that she was trying to help, but she didn't apologize or anything, it sounded less of a "gosh I'm sorry about that, let me help" and more of a "ugh I have to walk ALL the way back over here because of my stupid coworker".  I haven't ever witnessed anyone complain about their coworker like that to a customer.  She didn't apologize or say even a hello.

She asked me what I wanted, I ordered the Chirashi with miso soup.  When the waitress brought the miso soup, she didn't bring me any sort of spoon... But I was too timid to ask as I could tell she was in an awful mood, so I sipped my soup from the bowl.  Taste wise the soup was fine.

When my Chirashi came, the fish was HORRIBLY prepared.  It was as if the chef had never cut fish for sushi before.  Each piece was falling apart.  Worse yet, not a single piece tasted fresh, and half of the bites I took tasted like the fish was straight from the freezer.  I swear I felt the crunch of biting into ICE on one of the pieces.  It was shockingly awful.  There was a piece of mackerel that had skin on it still, and it was so POORLY prepped that I actually took a picture and sent it to people saying "look how awful this is".  Also, the shrimp was not only obviously straight from the freezer, but it still had bits of tail on it, that I didn't see as most had been removed.  I ended up having to reach inside my full mouth and pull out the bits.  It was disgusting.  Total amateur hour in regards to the fish prep.

While eating, there was a lovely soundtrack playing right behind me of the waitress complaining to some of the customers about how she'd "been working ALLLLLL DAY and just couldn't WAIT to get off, it's just been an AWFUL, LONG day."  The customers looked like they really just wanted her to walk away so they could eat..  She was checking her watch every few moments as well, in front of the customers, as if to say "eat fast, guys! I'm trying to go home here!"
The other waitress who had originally sat me without a menu left, and as she was leaving, the waitress I've been ranting about here shouts out the door after her, "hey next time, why don't you come in ready to work?  That would be GREAT" in an extremely sarcastic tone.  It was unbelievable that she did that in front of everyone.

She came to clear my dishes, and I hadn't finished everything... I didn't particularly want to, besides maybe the miso soup.  But I didn't even have the luxury of choosing whether or not to finish because she didn't ask if I was done, and just cleared my plates right away.  When she brought the check AND after collecting it, she didn't say a word.  The entire time I was there, I said thank you probably at least 6 or 7 times because that's what a proper midwest raised girl has been taught to do, and yet she didn't say thank you ONCE.  Not a single pleasantry was uttered from her mouth whatsoever, actually.  I said goodnight to myself and left as fast as I could.  I will NEVER eat here again, and I officially have no shame anymore directing people straight across the street to the WONDERFUL Sugoi Sushi, which I was actually planning to eat at had it not been closed.

Thank you We Be for an incredibly good opportunity to write an awful yelp review.  At least I have cleared up whether or not to ever eat at We Be Sushi ever again- a resounding NO!!  I'm keeping my yelp tab open in case I get food poisoning from the not-at-all-fresh fish, because I almost expect to at this point.
author: Haley G.

description:
Affordable. However, I didn't like the service or walk to the restroom, the food prep station was way too close. The waitress hassled me and my friends for a tip even though we were not ready to leave yet. 

It was really awkward. She was standing a couple feet from our table watching us like a hawk, didn't ask if we needed more food or drinks. After ten minutes she came over and very rudely asked for her tip. 

1. The place was not at all busy for her to make an attempt to pressure us to leave

2. We were there for a short period of time (no more than 30 min.)

Even though the food was very good, service is just as important for a good restaurant experience. 

#Rude

If you're wondering, we gave her a very generous tip.
author: Lulu M.

description: Literally just ordered it. Not good sushi at all. Can get better pre made sushi at Whole Foods
author: Brent M.

description:
My favorite old-school hole-in-the-wall SF sushi joint, without question. Get there before 7 PM and order the early bird special, and ask what's good. I have yet to be disappointed by that plan. Yes, you have to go thru the place to get to the bathroom. Yes, the service can be a bit spotty sometimes. If those kinds of things worry you, PLEASE do go elsewhere. Go to the OTHER We Be Sushi, the one I dislike, if you're like that. This one, the real We Be, is the genuine article. Oh, also, it's a great place for lunch.

Edit: reading some other reviews here, I gotta say that some folks must just be ordering the wrong things! I guess you just have to know what to get at which restaurant.... For me, if my GF or a friend wants to eat before 7 the Early Bird special puts this place at the top of my list, even compared to places that are much pricier. 5 stars.

Edit 2: I don't know what's up with the unhappy caucasian woman who works there. If you try to be nice to her, you might possibly get a half smile that lasts about a quarter of a second. With any luck, you'll get the nice Japanese lady for your server. Sorry, caucasian lady, but you seem miserable. I should probably downgrade my rating, but I won't.
author: Steven B.

description:
Food = 4 stars. Service = 2 stars. 

We've been eating here for the last 10 years and the sushi is consistently fresh and flavorful. The unpredictable choice in music adds to the ambiance.

Service is usually fine. But tonight we had a server, an older Caucasian woman, who was loudly harassing the other server the entire time we were there, shouting passive aggressive and nasty comments to her across the room from our table. She also kept trying to bring us into the drama by making little asides to us at the other woman's expense. Meanwhile, the other woman remained silent. It was extremely uncomfortable for us, and troubling. When we told the server we didn't want to be involved in her vendetta she got huffy and barked at the other woman to pick up our check. No hard feelings toward We Be on our part, but we just feel that management should be aware that this type of harassment is going on under their roof.
author: Liza S.

description: Very simple , very homey, very awesome. Seriously just simple and straightforward. Perfect neighborhood restaurant.
author: Abhi K.

description:
I love this place. It's small but very cosy! The menu is simple, but fish is always fresh! Prices are so low comparing to neighborhood restaurants! I've been coming here for 3.5 years and it became my favorite tradition!
Rolls 49's and Rainbow are to die for!
Fresh tuna and salmon melt in your mouth!
author: Mariya Delilah D.

description:
Great time at we be sushi last night. Stopped on not knowing what to expect. Ordered a bowl of udon and a California roll (the latter only because I was really hungry). 

Everything far surpassed my expectations and food was served quickly and with care. Udon veggie tempura has reset my standard.  This is now my favorite sushi joint.
author: Scott J.

description: Pretty bad service . Decent sushi . Melted dessert . I'll only come back for sushi that's in the area if there's nothing else.
author: Valerie P.

description:
Since I've been taking a class in the Mission for the last 6 weeks, I've been going a little early so I can go to the farmers' market and eat somewhere new before each class.  Today was my last class and I chose We Be Sushi as my dining choice of the evening.  

I got the Three's a Crowd roll (maguro, hamachi and salmon - loved this roll, I love my fish and if it's all in one, who can beat that?  Yum!!) and the Maui roll (deep fried soft shell crab with mango slices - loooved this too, the mango is subtle and adds a nice slight sweetness to the soft crunch of the yummy crab).  The two rolls were arranged so pretty on my plate and this was just the right amount to fill me up.  Loved the miso soup and the tea was good.  Service was good too!

We Be Sushi hit the spot!!  I will be back!!
author: Maile N.

description:
Said to be high in Protein, Vitamin A, and calcium.  In Japan it's eaten during summer because it's suppose to provide stamina.  Grilled then coated with a sweet sauce.  One of my favorite things in Japanese cuisine.  What am I  referring to?  Unagi or Fresh Water Eel.

I 'be' hungry today.  I 'be' wanting some Unagi.  So I went to We Be Sushi.  I took a seat at the sushi bar and placed my order.

Dragon Roll:  Thick roll of Unagi, Tempura, with avocado and cucumber.  I think it's called that because of the look of the Unagi and avocado makes it look like a dragon with scales across it's body.  Always one of my favorite rolls.  We Be Sushi, 'be' ok at making these.

Rainbow Roll:  A california roll with sashimi wrapped around it.  These rolls 'be' ok also.

Unagi-Don:  this bowl 'be' delicious.  I like the rice used at Japanese restaurants, it 'be' nice and sticky.  The bed of rice is then covered in Unagi, and you know how I feel about Unagi, it 'be' hella good.

Service was fine.  Decor isn't as nice as most Japanese eateries.  Prices are definitely cheap compared to other sushi spots.  Bang for buck-wise We Be Sushi 'be' hard to beat.  Can't go wrong with Unagi-Don.
author: Michael L.

description: Best sushi in the area, and love the fried calamari!
author: Anthony M.

description:
Came here for a late Monday night dinner-- around 9:00 PM.  After a Thanksgiving weekend of gorging myself on heavy foods drenched in gravy, a light sushi dinner was just what the doctor ordered.

Everything we ordered was well-priced and delicious.  There are times when one craves creative sushi rolls with lots of sauce, maybe even fried or baked.  This was not one of those times.  Their nigiri and maki were amazingly fresh.  We had the maguro, hamachi, fresh salmon, Tokyo maki, and saba maki.  Also their miso soup was among the best I've had, likely made in-house.

Service was efficient yet friendly.  The lady constantly came back to refill our water, and maintained a positive vibe without saying much.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Jamie B.

description: this rating is due to a rude delivery person that got our order via grubhub, on 5.17.2017 & dropped it of at 9.17 pm. it was such a bad attitude we did not tip him which we usually do, even though there is a delivery fee added on the bill. we be sushi is one of our restaurants & never had delivery from there. we were so badly surprised . this experience really left a bad feeling. its not a way to operate in a city with such large option for restaurants. both on grubhub and walk in. too bad:-(
author: Yoo Y.

description:
The BIGGEST draw back is this place is *CASH ONLY*.

I'd give 5 star's but the Cash Only thing is difficult. We rarely RARELY carry cash, and the person I was with had to walk a few blocks after dinner to get cash to pay. Honestly, we probably would spend more money if they had taken at the very least debit card.

It's tiny, it's cute, it's warm and clean.

Went here last night around 7:30/ 8. It wasn't super busy, but busy enough we were sat at a table with another couple we didn't know, but soon moved to another table of our own (thank goodness, they were talking SO loudly!). 

I was VERY impressed with the Sushi here, the grade of figh was great, had a true flavor, the sizes were accurate (no "american" size portions). Tea was hot and yummy. 

The staff were SUPER FRIENDLY. I was left as collateral while he went to grab some cash and her humor was on par, joked she would have me working the dish washer if he didn't return. Wish I had gotten her name, cute little thing and SO SWEET.

On a random note, the toilet in the bath room is SUPER low (no easy task when wearing high heels)
author: Meghan L.

description: The sushi's decent, but it's pretty pricey compared to what you would have to pay for in, say, Japantown. You can probably get similar grade sushi at the Nijiya Japanese supermarket in pre-packaged containers. To be fair, this is one of the few sushi joints in the Mission, so having the sushi be a little pricey is only fair.
author: Henry L.

description: I came in for an early dinner with my sons yesterday. They are school-aged, and perhaps the restaurant does not truly welcome families. I am not sure. But we really received such poor service from the kitchen, that I felt compelled to write a review. When we arrived there was only one other customer at the restaurant, and he had already been served. We sat down and placed our order. The waiter was nice enough, my complaints are not about him. The sushi chef received the order from our waiter, and he just walked away from the sushi bar! One of my kids had ordered chicken, and that came out right away.  But there were 4 of us, and obviously we wanted to eat at the same time. We sat around for about 15 minutes, waiting for someone to start preparing our sushi order. The waiter said nothing, noone acknowledged that we were being ignored. Finally a new chef came out and prepared his whole sushi prep setup. That took about another 10 minutes. The old sushi chef returned, and one of them finally made our order. By the time our sushi was delivered, the chicken was cold and we were in horrible moods. We ended up waiting almost 30 minutes from order to eat!  With noone else even in the restaurant! Then they brought us the bill and I was so angry to spend my hard-earned money on this place - we will never come back.
author: Ariel F.

description: Pretty chill spot. Our waiter was this very nice Japanese man. He seemed like the only waiter, which meant there was a little wait to place our order. Once our order was placed, the food came out pretty promptly. Really enjoyed our sushi rolls, the edamame, and seaweed salad. They also brought out water, tea, rice, and miso soup without even asking. I really enjoyed this meal.
author: Andrew S.

description:
I really like this place! The place is small, adorned with fun stuff on the walls, and clean (100 on food safety).

This is the kind of place you go and build a relationship with the people who work there. This is doable because it is very, very affordable! They have some fun rolls. I like the dill salmon one as well as the webe roll. The seaweed salad at WeBe is quite good. I liked it more than the seaweed salad at some more expensive establishments. 

Overall, it's inexpensive and don't scared away by sushi "purists".
author: Dian X.

description: I love homey cute places like this, simple and unpretentious. Shared the dinner special w my bf and they brought out an extra miso soup, so sweet of them. (And it was good miso too!) Nigiri was fresh, a nice basic assortment. Service was attentive and friendly, we didn't wait long to order or get our food. And they have natto-maki on the menu
author: A. R.

description:
I would say it's a good place for lunch, I went on a Friday at 12:30pm and was the only customer there, so there's always a seat! The feeling of the restaurant is very homey, it's not as fancy and uppity as other places on Valencia. 
The food was nothing to write home about. The softshell crab in my sushi was over salted and the tempura batter was a bit more like that of a corndog and didn't have that "fluffy crunch" of truly good tempura. The miso soup was filled with onions, which I personally do not like. However, the service was EXCELLENT.
When they were out of salmon skin for the roll I ordered, they let me choose a new roll, and charged me the same price even though I picked a roll that was twice as much! On top of that, they did not charge me for my miso soup. The waitress was every friendly and down to earth. I would recommend it for a quick place to get some cheap sushi!
author: Jenny S.

description: Got the early bird special, added two more 6 pieces, had a beer, it was like 26Good sushi at a great price!! Super happy!!
author: Paul R.

description:
We Be is your friendly neighborhood sushi joint. The sushi will satisfy a sushi craving but it's nothing to call home about. With that being said, if you're on a budget and in the neighborhood, this place is amazing! The staff is really friendly and it has a small, cozy atmosphere. 

I go here when I want a quick fix but don't want to spend loads of money on sushi. They also have a dinner special (from 5-7pm) that is such a good deal! 5 pieces of nigiri (your choice), a simple roll, seaweed salad, and miso soup..all for about $8. That's a great deal! 

For that price, you can't really complain. Oh, and this place is cash only!
author: Stephanie A.

description: Stopped in for a late dinner after a one man show at The Marsh. Ordered a chirashi bowl (amazingly fresh fish and the caviar was excellent) and a spicy tuna roll (our calibration dish... great taste with a spiciness not based on sriracha.
author: Abe L.

description:
Jiro wasn't dreaming of this sushi, that's for damn sure.  This is Jiro's nightmare!!!  Jive ass rolls (thanks Nobu!) aplenty!!!  Who ever thought cream cheese and fish could be so delicious?  It's cheap, it's tasty, they cook the rice properly, and they are genuinely nice people here.

It's easy to slam a place that isn't trying to spend more time patting itself on the back or making proclamations of their impotance to the world every chance it gets.  Bottom line, there is nothing wrong with this place. It may not be your taste if you don't want to be seen at an establishment that pairs cream cheese with tuna, but nobody forces anyone in the door.  If a wide variety of rolls under $5 and reasonably priced bottles of sake are ok by you then you might want to check this place out.  Oh, they have a health inspection score of 100 as well.

Somebody commented that the tuna here was probably frozen unlike "good" sushi places that don't use frozen fish.  Boy, I have news for you!  Tuna is the only fish that can be served raw in America without being frozen first to kill parasites...but even Jiro's tuna is bought frozen.
author: Luis M.

description: Awful restaurant, the bathroom is right in the middle of the Kitchen, the food is edible but the portions are ridiculous, DO NOT GO THERE!
author: Anis B.

description:
This is not the place you are looking for if you are in need for some high quality and well elaborated Japanese cuisine. Now, if what you want is a simple but decent meal for an inexpensive price this is your place.
The early bird deal is just ridiculous and honestly I don't think you can find something better for this price so in my opinion this is pretty awesome.
I have been here several times and I always go for the early bird or if out of time for some basic rolls to satiate my appetite for sushi. Usually I don't go fancy because I know this is not the place for that but once I ordered some calamari and surprisingly those have been the best calamari I had since I live in San Francisco!! So you never know...
Service is okay and yes, it is not the cleanest place in town but is decent.
You can't ask for more for what you are paying.
author: Mario B.

description: A legacy restaurant going back many moons nice to re-.connect. Appt across the street provided the excuse for a quick lunch bite. Special under $9 was perfect: filling; fresh; balanced. Ambiance so mellow. Humble staff; looking out for customer. Wish open between lunch and dinner!
author: Jim N.

description:
EARLY BIRD SPECIAL!!! It's a great deal even after 7pm. I also agree that the Miso soup here is rather legit. 

Don't forget - it's CASH ONLY.
author: E-dough R.

description: Wow, really great little neighborhood spot with excellent service! Met up with a friend that lives close by and popped in for a quick dinner. Very attentive but not annoying service and brought several freebies which was a pleasant surprise: miso soup, pickled spinach, seaweed salad, and green tea all without me requesting nor was I charged. Quite a nice surprise! We ordered several rolls and they were all fantastic. Highly recommend this little spot! Next time I'm in SF, I will be back!
author: Mary M.

description:
First off let me just say that a lot of the reviews on here for we be sushi are a little bit too unrealistic. Before you start thrashing the place on how low the quality of your meal was, honestly think how much you paid and how much you would have paid if you went somewhere that served to your expectation. You get what you pay for here at we be sushi but I thought it was good sushi for the money.

Yes you can go to Michelin star rated restaurants and get sushi that'll blow your mind and also blow your wallet or you can come to small places like we be sushi that have just one goal: SERVE SUSHI AT AN AFFORDABLE PRICE ALL DAY LONG.

I stumbled upon this location last night because the baby store that I wanted to go to closed early. So I walked in and decided to order some sushi to go. The lady helping me was super nice and my meal was prepared quickly as well. 

Quality wise, it's not bad. I mean I ordered 2 salmon nigiri, 2 tuna nigiri, 2 mirugai,1 hamachi negi, 1 salmon skin handroll, and 1 of their special rolls are for just $35 bucks! I mean that's a bargain right there! Everything was fresh and seasoning was good. 

I have no complaints and would recommend it to people in the area that are craving sushi. Think of this place like an In 'n Out joint but only Japanese instead. 

Happy Sushiing.
author: George L.

description:
This rating is for We Be Sushi as a place for vegans, as part of my Vegan the Mission trek. Well, seaweed-vegans. This is a sushi place. Not suitable for that % of vegans who don't touch seaweed.

Not only do they have several vegan sushis, they have a vegetarian (actually vegan) dinner with a decent miso and a choice of spinach or seaweed salad thrown in. 

So why the 5 stars? The vegetarian dinner shows major imagination, not simply being a sop so vegans will join their non-vegan friends.  There are two nigiris (avacado and cucumber), rice wrapped with tofu skin, and mushrooms just spilling out of a rice and seaweed wrap, plus an eggplant maki. If I'm extra-hungry, I get a squash maki as well. Essentially, it's a vegan tasting menu.

Tasty and interesting. Good show. I wouldn't eat here every week, but the dish is interesting enough that I can enjoy it a couple times a month.

As a side note, due to switching to being 95% vegan, I've been re-trying places that I had given up so long ago I've forgotten why. The first time I went back to We Be Sushi after years and years, I noticed that in the few front tables there were signs "Non-smoking section" inlaid into the tables. So I realized I stopped going there because there wasn't enough separation between smokers and non-smokers. Considering how long it's been since California restaurants went 100% non-smoking, that's a pretty long loss of my business to them for not being early non-smoking adopters years ago.
author: Charles B.

description: I was roaming around and decided to have sushi with my girlfriend and stumbled into this place. When we got there we were greeted very kindly and seated very shortly. I loved it because the waiter was a super sweet Asian guy, very attentive. After browsing the menu and seeing how inexpensive the rolls were we placed the order... The food was really fresh and the service was great. I would totally go back!
author: Cristy M.

description: Great sushi in a tiny spot. Not the prices of Valencia street you would expect! Especially if you go between 5 and 7 :).. Green tea and everything must go!
author: Lisa S.

description:
Fellow Yelpers and Scoutmobers beware!

-my sushi was...limp.
-the miso soup was awful (what was that, chicken broth?? yikes)
-both my friend and I agreed that theirs was the worst seaweed salad we've ever had
-and my friend's shrimp tempura was soggy!

For two Yelpers who are known to lick their plates clean...we have never left so much food untouched in our dining-out-in-SF lives!

The only dish we enjoyed was the grilled eggplant appetizer. One additional star for nice service and no wait but to be honest, if we hadn't received 50% off from Scoutmob I would have left even more dissatisfied.
author: Sarah Z.

description:
Now that I know what I know... 

I always thought that this We Be and the one near 16th were owned by the same people. Since they're not, I think it's time for a review of the one I really like.

In short, the staff here are awesome. They're more than happy to let you order and then run around the corner to the ATM (cash only) while they make your sushi take-out. They always offer to throw in extra miso soup, too.

But my favorite thing about this We Be is the vegetarian rolls. They are great! Not your standard asparagus and avocado roll like you get at any sushi spot - but really creative and delicious rolls.

The other We Be is ok, but I strongly prefer this one all around.
author: Gretchen S.

description:
If you're in the Mission and you're looking for decently-fresh sushi, We Be Sushi is your spot. 

A girlfriend and I came here for dinner after sunbathing in Dolores Park. It wasn't crowded and we were promptly seated by a very nice waitress. We had two waitresses trading off on us which was fine except one of them was a bit overly solicitous. She kept asking us if we wanted the back door closed and even after we insisted we were fine she told us she was going to close it in case our ankles got cold. It was a little weird but she was trying to be nice.

I ordered three different kinds of sashimi: albacore, bigeye tuna and yellowtail. The girlfriend ordered three different kinds of sushi (I don't remember what, exactly). We also shared a large plate of the mixed greens salad which was pretty tasty. It comes with that miso-y salad dressing that always comes on Japanese salads. 

The sashimi is huge. I have never seen sashimi this big before. It was a little off-putting and I was worried because there's nothing (food-wise) worse than bad sushi. But I bravely tried some bigeye and it was ok. Not the best, not the worst. Edible. The albacore was a little better and the hamachi (yellowtail) was surprisingly great. Very fresh, very buttery and tender. 

Our meal, with tip, ran us about $42 which I was ok paying considering the amount of food that we got. 

Someone wrote that this place is cash only but it's not. They happily accepted my credit card.
author: Christine P.

description: Closer to the true Japanese sushi places: busy, loud, small, simple. Delicious food. Great atmosphere.
author: Rika A.

description:
A-OK! I love this little place. Don't expect fancy presentations, and stick to ordering what you know and what is most likely to be fresh. You get what you pay for here and usually it is a very good deal as long as you know what to order.

 I work in The Mission so I appreciate lunch specials to their fullest and We Be Sushi does not disappoint, for $7 you can order a great vegetarian lunch special (1 eggplant roll drizzled with a sweet sauce alongside 4 assorted pieces, spinach or seaweed salad and a side of misoshiru soup!)

I also recommend trying the Mango 10 roll, especially if you are like me and haven't gotten the knack for raw fish just yet.
author: Alais d.

description: I really like this place because it's tasty and they give you awesome deals. I don't know many sushi places that gives you good rolls and allows 2 people to eat under 25 bucks with tax and tips! Their miso is really good but can be salty for some people. This place can get busy at times but it's worth the wait. Oh btw don't mistaken this place with the one on the 16th because it is totally different! I don't know why they have the same name.
author: Aylee G.

description:
I like the Vegetarian sushi plate, which comes with seaweed salad (and miso soup, which is not vegetarian, strangely, as it is made with fish broth).  The seaweed salad and veggie sushi rolls are yummy, and they give you two pieces of sashimi-style veggie sushi.  One of the sashimi's had a creamy slice of avocado instead of the fish, and the other had a crisp slice of cucumber.  All beautifully presented.  And they offer hot tea with your meal, free of charge.

I like that We Be Sushi is usually not too crowded so we can get a table, get some tasty nutritious food, and get in and out for about $10 per person, all told.  Especially at lunch (dinner prices are a bit higher).   The wait staff there have always been very friendly and efficient.  Also I love the great big fish kite on the wall.

My only quibble would be that they should clearly mark the miso soup as "not vegetarian" on the menu.  It was nice that the waitress mentioned this to me, but I think it would be pretty easy to make this clear right on the menu.  Otherwise, I wonder how many vegetarians or vegans may have ordered the "vegetarian" meal, assuming that the whole thing was vegetarian ... and not realizing that the "miso soup" portion of the meal isn't.
author: Rachel D.

description: OKay, so I was super surprised when I saw that this place only had three stars.  I'm from the midwest.  If "We Be Sushi" was out in chicago, they would receive a 5 star rating.  Sushi came out generally well prepared.  It was good quality.  I have absolutely NO complaints.
author: Esther S.

description: Fish is fresh - we had most of the sashimi and it wasn't bad, minus one which was still slightly frozen. Blech. I was expecting it to be terrible, but it was fine. Not the best and not the worst - definitely decent. They do accept credit card now though, so don't be like us and have someone slip out to get cash at the ATM and then find out they take card. Lol.
author: Cheryl L.

description:
I love small, quaint, unpretentious traditional sushi places like this. I am from Sacramento, and we have seen a sushi craze that killed off places like We Be Sushi in favor of large, trendy, clublike sushi restaurants that feature sauce laden rolls and lots of experimental combos.

Don't get me wrong - I like some of the newer sushi trends, but I LOVE places like We Be Sushi. First of all - what a silly name. Grabbed my attention everytime I walked by on Valencia and I knew I would eventually have to try it out. You have to walk through their kitchen area to get to their bathroom, which I find to be charming.

We ordered 2 rolls - the Not Philly roll and the Unagi roll. Both were a bargain at $4.50 a piece. Tasty and simple. We also split a beer and then bounced, leaving after only 20-30 minutes because there was quite a wait and we wanted to make sure people who were eating a full dinner received service.
author: Serena Q.

description:
Went to check it out for a Scout mob offer

Our server was so sweet, the sushi was yummy and it was affordable

for how cheap it was it could have been worse, this place is great
author: Lita T.

description: Been eating here for years and am always happy with the experience. Not amazing but predictably ok. But the new red ambient lighting HAS TO GO. The place is unnecessarily dark and the menu impossible to read. Please management, put the original lighting back.
author: Natasha C.

description:
Every time I have been to We Be, my experience has been good, but not great. I have never needed to wait for a table (even though it's always been busy), and the staff are friendly. 

I say good, but not great due to the quality of the sushi. I have ordered many different rolls and nigiri, and though the quality of the fish itself has been fine, the ratio of fish:rice or fish:additives in the rolls has been lacking.

This is a great place to grab reasonably fast sushi at a good price, but if you want *sushi* (read italics), I would recommend finding another spot.
author: Adam K.

description:
The bf and I strolled on over here one night with a craving for sushi since it's the closest Japanese joint (within walking distance) from my apartment. We were seated as soon as we walked in and our waitress was this quirky lady with pigtails. 

It was a really small but cozy restaurant filled mostly with tables for 2. The lighting was dim and had random Japanese artwork on the walls. The cool neon "We Be Sushi" sign hung above where the kitchen began towards the back of the room. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9kqooKOcH_o-KuumqAGIpQ?select=5f2TExWQ35mFtpJpOGEbJg) It was definitely busy in there but our food and beverages came out fairly swiftly. Their complimentary miso soup was hot and not too salty...great way to start our meal!

spider roll ($8.50) - Decent amount of the deep fried soft shell crab...was interesting since there was spinach and carrots in the middle of the roll. Not bad though since each piece was bigger than just a bite size.

one of a kind roll ($8.50) - Consisted of shrimp tempura and spicy tuna...simple enough but a little too much rice and the tuna was almost nonexistent. I swear I just tasted the spiciness but didn't see any fish...did we get jipped?

catch of the day roll ($4.75) - Unique twist on a fresh salmon roll since the meat was marinated in sake and dill first. The salmon was refreshing with a hint of tartness but the flavor may take some getting used to. This was my fave out of all the rolls though...yummy!
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9kqooKOcH_o-KuumqAGIpQ?select=rMmEppo-KnYHpA4yufEmoA)

caterpillar roll ($8.50) - Pretty typical caterpillar roll with unagi and cucumber wrapped in avocado but disappointed there was no special sauce for it. Just like the one of a kind roll, waaaay too much rice and avocado, tiny piece of unagi. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9kqooKOcH_o-KuumqAGIpQ?select=l4FPiYiuujZgR4QHFOxjhg)

Overall, I liked how the rice was sticky/soft so that the sushi didn't fall apart as easily. Everything did taste fresh but the ratio from one ingredient to another may have been off. I definitely filled up on all that rice though!

You get what you pay for I guess. The rolls were modestly sized but also really cheap for sushi. Their roll choices were pretty extensive and also offer nigiri, maki, sashimi, udon, and combo specials. I would be willing to come back to try their other options. Cash only!
author: Karen Y.

description: Good sushi but not going to bust the bank. There's always a place to sit, people are friendly and have a great attitude.
author: Joel M.

description:
The service here was fast and attentive.  However, the food was a bit lacking given their prices.  We ordered a negihama maki, unagi maki, and salmon maki.  First came a bowl of free miso soup.  It was nice and hot, but a bit overly salty.  Then came the rolls.  They took into consideration the fact that two people were sharing the three rolls.  They split the sushi evenly between two sides of the plate in a neat pattern.  The hamachi wasn't the freshest, but the salmon was alright.  The unagi was delicious. 

One thing that was a little annoying was the fact that they automatically added 18% gratuity to our lunch because we used a Scoutmob coupon.
author: Eeway H.

description:
Beggars can't be choosers. If you want the cheapest sushi in town, I think We Be Sushi can accomodate you. But if you're expecting too much of a good thing you'll be disappointed. If you're a sushi snob, try some luck at Ino Sushi, Koo or Kiss. This place serves mediocre graded fish, but they pay really close attention to how they roll the sushi, what ingredients match together in a roll and also service. They place your sushi orders on a lacquered tray altogether and you eat it off there. 

I thought the two ladies were efficient, friendly and really attentive. They deserve a good star for this. Oh, they don't take cards, so prepare some cash. I've come here more than once, and it's my place to go if I need fast, cheap-ass sushi to fill up my stomach after the intense capoeira session!
author: Rika P.

description:
Meh. I didn't like this place. The communication between the waitress and the kitchen staff was probably a large factor in why this place won't be seeing me again. 

My udon came too hot to eat and the noodles were too mushy by the time it cooled off enough to eat it. 

They also forgot a few items but never checked in so that we could remind them. The waitress also placed an assumed order of veggie tempura for us that was horrible and we didn't even eat it because it was soaked with oil. Gross. 

I hate leaving bad reviews. Anyone know if a good Japanese joint around here?
author: Autumn B.

description:
Worst sushi ever. My friend agreed. We were walking back to her house, praying that it wouldn't be a scene from Bridesmaids. Fortunately, by the grace of God, it wasn't.  

The sushi wasn't fresh at all. Between the taste & the texture, that was obvious. I ate the pieces that were edible, and left a few that weren't. The miso was the best part. It's cheap sushi, yes. But so what? My recommendation: if you're on super low budge, stick to tacos.
author: Jen M.

description: Yech. I've had decent food and decent service here before but it's never been great. They were fast (I ordered chirashizushi) but the fish was really really bad. I know most sushi is prefrozen to kill parasites but either the fish I had was still nearly frozen or it was incredibly rubbery and smelled like "fish" (the saba was the worst culprit, I had to spit it out into a napkin). The service was blah, curt and uninterested. If the food was decent the service wouldnt have mattered. I hope they figure things out, we dont need another longtime SF place replaced with a techworker place called "The 16-bit lunch" or whatever.
author: señorito K.

description:
While I was getting a manicure from hell with my friend, we figured we should grab dinner afterwards. 

She was really craving sushi and I wasn't even hungry so I went with it. I wanted to go to Valencia so I told her to look for a sushi place in that area. She yelped it on her handy dandy new iPhone and found We Be Sushi. We thought it was a cute name so we just chose it. Haha. 

It looked pretty shady from the photos but it was nice inside. Parking was a bitch and it took me forever. I saw a million restaurants I wanted to go to while walking to the restaurant: Spork, Dosa, Herbivore. 

My friend didn't realize it was cash only but the prices were really cheap so it was fine. I didn't plan on ordering anything until our waitress brought both of us complimentary miso soup and then I had to order something. I got the salmon sashimi that was $4.50. It was the best sashimi I've ever had. It was really fresh and they were big pieces too. My friend loved whatever she got, I don't remember what it was. Some roll and a bowl of white rice. The restaurant is relatively small. I kind of got lost coming back from their bathroom since its way in the back but the nice cooks pointed me in the right direction. They have a really strange collection of music but I liked all the songs. 

I think they have a bunch of other locations. I've seen a few in the same area and those look a lot better than the one we went to. Totally thought my car got towed when we were leaving. We walked up and down the block a few times and it was no where to be found. Turns out it was parked on the block ahead. Haha.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
I'm going to go with some of my fellow constituents and say this place is okay...and perhaps less than mediocre.

They did not have scallop.  They admitted to having very-much-frozen amaebi.  And their rolls are very uninspiring.  

Prices are okay but if I'm getting such uninspiring food...I should really pay less.  

Also, service was spotty.  We had different servers throughout the meal.  Plus one of them was quite abrupt and pestered us about ordering (and it was fairly empty on a Tuesday night!!)   

No food poisoning or anything of that sort, but I wouldn't go here willingly for a second try.  

Next!
author: Fannie S.

description:
We Be Sushi is good and cheap and the name is oh-so-fun to say! We ordered a variety of rolls at this cute, little location and each were about $3-$5. Wow! I never would have expected them to taste nearly that good for the price! Both the fish and veggies tasted fresh.

We did not have to wait for a table and servers were very sweet and attentive. I only wish that We Be were not such a trek from my place!
author: Meghan P.

description:
We be sushi?

More like...we won't be doing sushi here,

Any longer.

I've given this place too many chances.

BOOOoooooooooo.

The sushi is bland and unremarkable.

It was actually my bf's idea to stop in here for his first experience with sushi.

What a mistake!

What a horrible introduction to sushi.

It's been hard to convince him how incredible quality fresh sushi really is,

After sampling We Be Sushi's attempts.

We Be Sushi may be a decent option for a quick bite, if you have low expectations,

But there are just too many amazing sushi places in San Francisco to settle.

We Be over We Be Sushi.
author: Jessica T.

description: It's a little sad to be writing a negative review for We Be Sushi since everyone that works there is so super nice. But bottom line, their sushi is not good. The fish seems old and not fresh, and nothing has a unique taste. It would be so convenient if this place was good because I'm always in this area.
author: Ryan M.

description:
They clearly do NOT have their act together.  The sushi itself was not bad (not outstanding either). Getting the food took way too long.  In fact they forgot about an additional item, we waited for 20 min unattended and I finally spoke up.  

They had not even STARTED to make it!.

Then they charged us gratuity on the check after all of that...Will not be back.
author: Nathaniel H.

description:
Cheap, no frills, basic sushi found in a pretty unassuming and uneventful locale.  Good place to stop by before you head on towards the bars in the Mission for a long night of crawling on all fours.

I usually get the maguro and hamachi, and they are decent for the price.
author: Miika M.

description:
This is another one of those over-hyped sushi joints that's usually touted as being super-inexpensive, but as usual, turns out to be overpriced for how seriously bad the food is!

The place feels so dirty and cramped, you begin to wonder if part of how they keep costs down involves employing cockroaches in the kitchen as their sushi chefs.  And unlike most sushi restaurants, this dive really seems to place very little, if any, value on the artistry of food placement...your dinner will arrive looking decidedly unspecial.  The rolls are super-small, and as uninteresting on the tongue as they were on the plate.

I can only conclude that people who buy into their whole motto of sushi "just like Mom used to make" had mothers who were terminally domestically impaired...
author: Amy L.

description:
Ugh,  ughhhh.  This is my memory of We Be Sushi (or as my friend and I call it, wey bey sushi).  So seriously, we only went to this place in the first place because we thought there was a deal on this place from Scoutmob (turns out the deal is on the We Be Sushi near 16th...but also on valencia, LAME.)  First of all, this place is small, so we had to pull up a chair JUST for the 3 of us, and we were elbow to elbow with the couple next to us.

Next, cash only! blah, especially we were like 1 dollar short with the cash that we had, one of us had to go use the atm at the liquor next door.

Food:  mediocre at best.  I had the chirashi bowl: small and non-distinct.  Sad to say, the best part of the meal was our seaweed and spinach salads.  And when the best part of the meal is the complimentary salads, that is really sad.

Lets just say we won't be back here any time soon!
author: Alex T.

description: Great value, great taste Sushi rolls.  I am Japanese and I go here often. I would give 4.5 stars!!! They have lunch special - best deal.  Dinner sushi plate is great too. Their fish quality is very high -  try Eel, Salmon Roe, Tobikko, and We be roll.
author: Miho Y.

description: Solid sushi and decent prices. Cool space. Nice pierced waitress. I don't understand how they have the same name but are different from the other WBS.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I'll agree with the masses here; this place is a solid 3 nearing 3.5.

Came in for lunch and got a few of the specials (I'm a hungry kid).  The sushi special which is something like a WeBe roll (cucumber, eel (?) and cream cheese) and four pieces of assorted nigiri is good for $7.50.  A small sample of fish and a decent roll for a pretty good price and might I add without the lame ol boring California roll.  I also had the chicken teriyaki special to really round things out.  It's quite an opulent dish served with rice, tomatoes, cabbage salad and a generous serving of chicken.  The chicken was ok; tasty but a little dry at times.  At $7.50 I couldn't really complain.  Both dishes came with a new favorite which was the Japanese spinach salad.  It's essentially like seaweed salad though I found it less "saucy".  Easily one of the better ways I've had spinach prepared without making it taste like it's health value is gone. 

The restaurant had the other intangibles.  The space is nice and cozy, definitely a great spot if you're looking to catch up with an old friend in a not too noisy atmosphere.  There was some enjoyable Lawrence Welk type music playing in the background that was rather enjoyable given the afternoon.  The service was good and prompt with both dishes coming out one after the other.

Quality ingredients and quality food however given other options for fresh fish in the City, this place ranks in the middle of the pack.  Will likely come back for the noodles at some point.
author: Steven R.

description:
Would I come back? Probably.
Will I reccomend it to anyone? No.

We Be Sushi (cool name aside) is a no frills small sushi spot.  It's the sushi equivalent to a dive bar.  However, the food is a tad better than expected, meaning it's passable.


The service is pretty good, but not good enough to make up for everything else.

My advice--if you are craving sushi, and you are right in front of the restaurant and you do not want to drive anywhere else--why not?
author: David C.

description:
This is a cheap, homestyle Japanese restaurant that specializes in sushi. The  service is friendly and relatively quick and the food is much better than I expected for the price. The miso soup is great, seaweed salad good, and the rolls and nigiri I had were generally well prepared and fresh, with good preparation of the rice. The one exception was the ikura-- it was pretty terrible and smelled old, but I ate it anyway, so here's hoping I don't get sick.

My advice is to stick to the specials here and avoid the fancier stuff (like the ikura), because I don't think it gets ordered often and likely will be old.

Overall, an excellent value with good food and I will be back!
author: Jacqueline A.

description: The food is cheap, but beware-you get what you pay for. Nothing tasted fresh and even the miso soup was not so good. I've never had subpar miso soup!
author: Koko C.

description:
Great lunch place. They have very generous combos - miso soup, salmon teriyaki with rice and salad for $7.95. Can't beat that. Food is always solid. 

Also, no longer cash only.
author: Emily L.

description: This place is great. The food is fresh, comes out fast and the service is excellent. Definitely recommend and they accept cards!
author: V BO M.

description:
Great food, but get there early as it's small and doesn't have many tables!
I order to collect and the sushi is amongst the best I've had in SF. 
Chicken Teriyaki was so-so (so no 5 stars) otherwise great stuff at very reasonable prices.

Alan D
author: Alan D.

description:
Party of 6 on Sunday night, 9pm.

We had a great time!  For having missed the dinner rush, we were seated immediately towards the back.  We ordered a 72-piece sushi (i believe it was $75).  There was also 128-piece set for the same price, but it consisted of smaller pieces so we passed for the next occassion.

The sushi pieces were good.  Nothing amazing, but the order was so simple and worry-free that we will definitely return some time.  It was a happy, communal meal that I could do again any weekend.

The big bonus was the free miso soup.  It's kind of my pet peeve when sushi restaurants charge for that.  Miso soup is usually just boiled from a powder mix, costs like $2 for a gallon of it!! Why do they charge so much for it?  It's even worse then mexican restaurants charging for chips (since chips are actually more pricey, and their margin on food are smaller).

Anyways. great vibe.  Cute waitress.  Good time with friends.  Enjoy!
author: Eugene L.

description: I have mixed feelings towards we be sushi. On one hand, I found service was better during their lunch hour than for dinner. I keep coming back because of their uni which is affordable and never tastes fishy. Their California rolls are better than other places that serve them-i believe they use real crab meat due to the fine shreds of it in the roll that imitation can't create and there isn't any mayo added. Nigiri wise, you can't go wrong with their amaebi and uni. I've always had those fresh here and have no chewy texture that some of the other reviews are referring to.  To conclude this review, I would recommend coming here if you want a quick sushi fix FOR LUNCH because service and price are the best during their lunch hours-from my experience anyway.
author: Trisha M.

description:
Walking in feels like you are in someone's home with just a few more chairs. Kitchen and refrigerator are in plain site, as is the sushi chef, who has that "stay out of my kitchen while I prepare sushi" look.

You've got a deal, especially when it's as good and cheap as this. Had a hard time deciding between grilled calamari with cucumber or a grilled eggplant roll. Went with the former seeing as it was more unique, and I don't regret my decision at all. It was very good, especially for only $5.

Not just we be sushi, but we be good, cheap and unique sushi. A well earned four stars.
author: Jason B.

description:
Friendly staff, good service. I love going here when I'm broke but craving sushi (and sake, and Asahi). For its price, it's probably the best 'cheap' sushi (and most convenient for me). This place is the original "We Be Sushi", so beware of the other one on 17th/Valencia and the one on Geary--it's not the same!

I'd also like to add, despite what people say about "getting what you pay for", I've had better and fresher sushi here than in places that charge double-triple the price at fancy shmancy restaurants. Just be aware that this place is "cash only", so head to the ATM before you decide to check in.
author: Zell C.

description:
My standards are pretty low when it comes to sushi.  Cheap and fast can do it for me.  Maybe even reach the level to warrant a 5-star review.

This place exceeded my (very low) expectations, but it's the kind of place you expect in the mission:  populated to the brim with hordes of malnourished hipsters who've helped gentrify this neighborhood.  That's what it's got going for it:  the foot traffic.

It's a middle-of-the-road kinda place, and unfortunately the two rolls I ordered weren't doin' it for me.  I can't say they were memorable.

Now I'm not saying I'm only impressed with hyped up and overpriced sushi-- but I can't justify giving this place more than 3 stars just because it's cheap and has attentive servers.  It really isn't anything I plan to return to.

We Be Sushi, you do you, I'ma do me.
author: L J.

description:
I'm not usually a picky or critical person but we ordered a regular maki roll and a special roll that was deep fried. I was in the restroom when the first roll was served to us. It was so small I thought it was a complimentary roll. It tasted alright but that's a kid's sized sushi roll! 

 They served complimentary miso soup & I always like it but this time, that was not the case. The soup was not as tasty as most miso soups I've had before and there were chunks of onion in there, which I did not expect.

  The deep fried spicy unagi roll was finally served to us. Usually, when you bite into a deep fried roll it is still crunchy. Can I get a witness?! This roll was soggy! 

  I mean, I give them props for having great service but the quality of the food could be so much better! It tasted good but texture really adds to the taste.
author: Trina C.

description:
I know that there is a lot of sushi in SF, so finding a place that is worth going back to is difficult, you want to try them all. I love We Be Sushi because of the no-frills, raw fish on some rice menu that they provide. Nothing too fancy, no weird combinations that you have to heavily weigh before ordering, and no $14 rolls that you'll come to regret by the end of the meal. 

The atmosphere is homey, the waitstaff is friendly and quick, and the fish is fresh. What else could you really want? 

I ordered a large assortment of sashimi, and loved every piece of it. Everything was incredibly fresh and flavorful without being too fishy. 

Don't get me wrong, I love me some boutique sushi, but if I'm ever just in the mood for fresh raw fish, plain and simple, I'll go to We Be. 

Oh yeah, and the prices are awesome.
author: Lindsay J.

description:
Fantastic restaurant. great service! Nice atmosphere.
There's no complain...except they don't have the japanese cool noodles...
author: Xiu L.

description:
Meh ... unimpressed by this place. I was craving some sushi near work, and this place presented itself. Should have known: sushi in the Mission = bad sushi.

The service was slow and unresponsive, and all I wanted was a bento box to go. When I finally got said box, it was lacklustre at best.
author: Wes T.

description: So pissed, their food truck came to SF state campus on the 27th. The guy claimed that my card didn't process the first time, so he swipe my card again when my roll was ready. Now I have two transactions stuck on my card and no way to even contact to get it back. The fried spicy tuna roll was pretty soggy. And the guy that took my order was pretty rude and seemed kinda resentful when taking my order of one roll.
author: Sarah L.

description: I'm no food snob but I can't believe this place has  3 stars. Terrible service, below average sushi, nothing redeeming at all about this place.  AVOID!
author: Will M.

description:
Relatives have been raving about this place to me for a while. It lived up to their hype. Very fresh, very affordable, very tasty. 

As a side note, one of the reviews said that the place was cash only; this wasn't the case for me. They happily took my plastic.

I feel like giving 5 stars, but as I've been living away from the Pacific for a couple of years, my palate might be damaged.
author: Emily K.

description:
My sis and I came here on a hot SF day looking for some food that wasn't also hot (in temperature).  

We ordered three rolls and split them between the 2 of us. (Tuna salad roll, shrimp tempura roll, and a crab roll (i think)).  We didn't realize that we had picked all spicy rolls.  But I like spicy so it wasn't a problem.  The rolls were delicious and on point.  Before receiving our rolls the waitress brought us some miso soup.  (Yeah, hot soup on a hot day.) The soup was great, not too salty. 

The staff was very friendly.  One of the chefs made sure to say "thank you" to every patron on their way out.  We had a pleasant meal for $20 and would definitely come back and try some of their lunch specials.
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
"Irrashaimase!"

When that's the first thing I hear entering a restaurant, I know there's something special about it. We Be Sushi might not be the shiniest or the most glorious sushi place in town, but they definitely serve some tasty food.

I got:
- Saba nigiri  (mackerel)
- Unagi nigiri  (eel)
- Uni nigiri  (sea urchin)
- Tekka maki (white tuna)

The nigiri were made well, good portions and the little dallop of wasabi inbetween rice and fish like you're supposed to. I'll be really honest I didn't experience any foodgasms, but all were pretty tasty (the saba was particularly yummy!). I even got a miso soup, I think it's complimentary.

Service was fantastic the whole time, and the bill wasn't bad at all. I'd totally go here again.
author: Ayumi Y.

description:
We Be Sushi is a great place for quick and cheap sushi.  It's a hole in the wall place that serves pretty average rolls for dirt cheap prices and pretty good appetizers in large portions.  

The server was really nice when we asked her about almost each item on the appetizer list.  And after the 1st or 2nd request for a tea refill, she was on it for the rest of the night so we were happy diners.

Would I go back?  Sure, it satisfied my mild craving for food.  I know better than to expect gourmet at a locale like this so it was good for what it was.
author: Karen N.

description:
Since Minako was closed Tuesday night my date and I casually sauntered over to We Be Sushi about an hour before closing. There wasn't a customer in sight. Lucky for us, we were able to get the best seat in the house and great service.

The staff was very attentive and friendly. My cup of hot tea was never empty as the server made sure to refill after every few sips.

I ordered the Rainbow Roll and the Sake Nigiri. It was interesting that they serve smoked salmon nigiri and fresh nigiri. Of course I opted for the fresh nigiri. 

The sushi is decent, but not as fresh as I was hoping for. On the plus side the Rainbow Roll had generous cuts of raw fish on top.

Great for a late night bite in the Mission.
Super affordable prices.
Large selection of specialty rolls.
They had a lot of vegetarian rolls on the menu.

Most importantly! This is another CASH ONLY establishment.
author: Cellina B.

description: I like going here for lunch, bring cash though! It is very simple and straightforward fare brought quickly and for not a heap of money. I wouldn't plan on it for a fancy date or anything, but it hits the spot on a summer afternoon.
author: Jean G.

description:
WARNING:  stick with the vegetarian sushi.

The vegetarian sushi was not bad -BUT- the fish that we ordered was not at all fresh.  I have an iron clad stomach and this is one of the very few restaurants where I left feeling queasy.  

I do, however, recommend their vegetarian sushi, but then again, I don't generally go to a sushi joint for vegetarian fare.
